I can definitely vouch for that anecdotally haha If that's not spiritual then nothing is :D Thanks for your kind words. They make me really proud.
I should say that I do recommend real therapy, or professional support of some other kind, if you are struggling with your mental health. It has helped me loads.
Thanks sooooo much. I vow to never stop.

If someone was making a documentary about you, what question would you most hope they didn't ask?
Do you think there's anything unethical in using your feigned ignorance to rile people up?
Thank you. I'm super interested in evolutionary psychology. So I have a tendency to see things this way.

WRITING.TEXT: Like why not start the Dyspraxic Drawings instagram? I'll follow you. Hope this doesn't sound flippant or insensitive. I'm being sincere.

Thanks so much. Yeah I sell them as greeting cards online and in St Nicks market. And now have 4 stockists (Brighton, Bristol and London). So it's going really well. I've contacted some people in dog rescue to volunteer my illustration skills to their cause.

I'm sorry about that. Sounds frustrating. This is going to sound really compliment fishing but I'm actually not that great at drawing. These rely more on the joke, and I've always done idea-based art. Then you don't need great technical skills but can just rely on creativity. There are loads of comics out there that are "poorly drawn" but if you can muddle your own style out of your dyspraxia and maybe make the artwork reference that there's no reason people can't still enjoy your drawings. Apart from that it's just practice for me. Also I do every drawing in pencil first and it takes me absolutely ages and tonnes of rubbing out to get it right. And then you can make it look like you new what you were doing all along by tracing with a pen afterwards (a window is good for tracing on non-tracing paper). Basically just do it for you, do what looks good to you and don't necessarily target photorealism, there are loads of people who can do that well.
Thank you so much :D

WRITING.TITLE: Be More Dog (a drawing i did)

WRITING.TEXT: Hey, I see that you are (maybe) vegan so maybe you will prefer this one: http://i.imgur.com/uDXn9GQ.jpg Hope that's not presumptive. Also I do know that some people do eat dogs.
I'm sure that's true in many cases.

Hey, so the joke is kind of contextual. Lots of people feel like particularly right now there is a lot of fear and hate in the world. Dogs seem, to me at least, to be completely bling to each others physical appearance. My dog will play with any dog just the same regardless of its breed. So the joke is a very naive, simplistic comment about racism. But sometimes naive simplicity is what we need.

WRITING.TITLE: Anywhere can be a locker room if you imagine it hard enough: a park, a bus, an oval-shaped office.
Anywhere can be a locker room if you imagine it hard enough: a park, a bus, an oval-shaped office.
Anywhere can be a locker room if you imagine it hard enough: a park, a bus, an oval-shaped office.

WRITING.TEXT: That was not, in fact my intention, but of course if that is the impression you got that is due to an error in clarity on my part. The comment was intended as a comment on the wave of racism that has followed Brexit. Where humans see racial categories and have tended to allow (or encourage) these to become divisive, dogs seem to often just see dogs. Not Staffies and Golden Retrievers but just another dog to be treated as any other dogs. And for lots of dogs this means, to be played with. It's obviously a naively simple take on racism but naive simplicity is what's called for sometimes perhaps?

WRITING.TITLE: Comic I did about Post-Brexit Britain [OC]

WRITING.TITLE: Help with printing problems. Blurry, smudged prints after about 6th print.
WRITING.TEXT:
So [this](http://imgur.com/LzmThhi) keeps happening after about the 6th print. Can anyone tell me what I might be doing wrong. It basically looks like there's too much ink going through the screen.
I am using a 120T screen with waterbased ink and using a 2 pence piece for off contact. I feel like the problem might be my flood stroke, perhaps I'm pushing too hard?
What do people mean by bug bulb?
https://www.daveroper.co.uk/store/product/diy-table-top-screen-printing-kit Same kit but cheaper if that's what you go with

WRITING.TITLE: Can anyone who owns SCREEN PRINTING equipment help me out?
WRITING.TEXT: I would like to sell my drawings as greetings cards. I've redrawn my designs to make them work as cards, here's an [example](http://i.imgur.com/GyCb93T.jpg) (it'll fold down the middle). They're all 1 colour A4 prints. I want to print some samples to take into shops and see if they want to stock them. The problem is I don't have much money and the quotes I have got so far for screen printing involve a big initial outlay before the costs start to fall. I was wondering if anyone could give me a deal on a small print run because they believe I will succeed and return with more business.
[This paper](http://www.yale.edu/darwall/Fin%20de%20siecle.pdf) is a very good introduction to contemporary metaethics.

Your thought experiment is not very different to Robert Nozick's [experience machine](http://www.hhimwich.com/files/exper_machine_nozick.pdf) I would recommend you explore the responses that Hedonists have offered to that. In particular [this.](http://www.jstor.org/stable/23559087?seq=1#page_scan_tab_contents)

I am a man. And very grateful for your input. I will definitely get it traced into a vector at some point. The thing is I'm unsure about how I plan to use it. My mum asked for a logo and this image of an exploded baguette diagram came to mine so I drew it.

Ok is that to do with it sticking in people's minds better if it's simple?

Ok, I hadn't thought of that. Thank you.
I will try it without hatching. I printed it on a label yesterday though and it came out surprisingly well. I guess it would be smaller than that in some digital uses though.
Thanks for your help.

Ok so I'll preamble with "Explaining a joke is like dissecting a frog. You understand it better but the frog dies in the process." but the basic idea is that we regularly ask dogs "Who's a good dog?" and in this imagined scenario the dogs have taken this question to heart and spent their lives searching for an answer to return to the humans.
Thanks, do you have any suggestions for simplification. Perhaps just a reduction in hatching?
Thank you
Those are actually the only parts that are supposed to be legible so this is good news.

WRITING.TITLE: [Logo] I am not a designer by any means but my mum asked me to draw a logo for her sandwich shop and now I need criticism.
WRITING.TEXT:
Hand drew a [logo](http://i.imgur.com/2qSCbPr.png) for my Mum's sandwich shop. We mostly sell filled baguettes. I plan to add the name of the sandwich shop in arcs above and below the circle and perhaps the date it was established (1998). I recognise that it is a very detailed design. It won't be on the shopfront but may be on flyers, menus, labels and signage inside the shop. The next step is to pay someone else to add text and convert it into a vector image I guess.
Any help or advice is massively appreciated. I'm doing a philosophy degree and have no idea how logoing works.
That's a good point and something I had worried about. Thank you.
more at facebook.com/subject9486 or subject9486.tumblr.com

WRITING.TITLE: [AMA Request] Any of the Labour party (UK) leadership contenders. I would like to see some important British politicians on Reddit.
WRITING.TEXT:
**My 5 Questions:**
1. What is the Labour party fundamentally about? 2. Was the recent campaign too left, or too right, wing? Or why is that the wrong question? 3. Why has the Labour party completely accepted the Conservative narrative on the need for austerity? Shouldn't we have spent more during the recession? 4. What would you have done differently in opposition from 2010-15? 5. What makes you an interesting person outside of your political life?
Andy Burnham https://twitter.com/andyburnhammp Liz Kendall https://twitter.com/leicesterlizhttps://twitter.com/leicesterliz Yvette Cooper https://twitter.com/yvettecoopermp Mary Creagh www.twitter.com/marycreaghmp
haha
Thanks. I'm British so never seen a real copy of The New Yorker. But I know that that's a real compliment.
